channel.title: Copy of Digg top 24 hours
channel.description: RSS feed with direct links to popular technology articles. based on superdigg pipe

item.title: [+1694] Comic Reads Email from Ex Asking if He Has AIDS
item.description: Peet reads an email from an anonymous girl after a steamy rendezvous. Peet is also a Digg user named PunkHop and is, by virtually all reputable accounts, a scholar and a gentleman.

item.title: [+1360] The Evolution of Steve Jobs (pic)
item.description: He really likes his black shirt and blue jeans...

item.title: [+1181] Porcupine who thinks he is a puppy!
item.description: This 5 year old male was a pet in a home, and now lives at the Alaska Wildlife Conservation Center. This little guy had been given an apple to eat, and seems to act more like a puppy than a porcupine!

item.title: [+1142] My Goat is in a pen (pic)
[+800] I'm Just a Companion Cube [Pic]
item.description: This is a result of using the Portal gun the wrong way. The poor companion cube is lost somewhere in the world.

item.title: [+784] Inception: if you're on Digg, you're(probably) smart enough
item.description: Watch as animated(literally) film critics prove only a dumb ass would hate this movie.

item.title: [+719] Christopher Nolan Sneaks into Theater. Theater Shuts Down.
item.description: If you’re Christopher Nolan and your film Inception is about to gross a $21 million Friday, wouldn’t you want to sneak into a theater to check out audience reaction? Unfortunately for Nolan, he chose the wrong screening last night.

item.title: [+637] Mystery trader buys all Europe's cocoa
item.description: Even Willy Wonka might struggle to use this much chocolate. Yesterday, somebody bought 241,000 tonnes of cocoa beans.

item.title: [+568] 22 Coolest and Creative Watch designs
item.description: Watches around your wrist shows your life taste: modern, cool or luxury. Which is your favourite: Multiple Time Zone watches, Jump Hour watches, Perpetual Calendar watches, LED watches,Mystery Dial watches, Swiss watches or Skeleton watches?

item.title: [+564] 'Inception' Takes No. 1 Spot at Box Office Over The Weekend
item.description: Ummm...what did you expect really? If you haven't seen it please do yourself a favor, get off the computer and get into the theater. Anyways...it's estimated take is $60.4 million beating out last week's "Despicable Me"

item.title: [+563] 5 Unwinnable Situations from Classic 80s Games
item.description: It was once common practice to have situations in which it becomes impossible to complete a videogame. To add insult to injury, the games in question rarely mentioned that fact to the player, leaving them to lurch around forever without knowing that the only way to succeed was to turn off the game and start from scratch.

item.title: [+506] Should BP Execs Go To Jail?
item.description: The multi-million dollar criminal fines paid by BP did nothing to deter its risky ongoing conduct. The fines were simply a cost of doing business for BP. The only way to change this dynamic is to not only charge the corporation but also those individuals responsible for the corporate crime.

item.title: [+495] Rivals Hit Back at Apple Over 'Death Grip' Claims
item.description: Research in Motion, Nokia, and HTC hit back at Steve Jobs after he claimed that all smartphones have "weak spots" that could lead to the "death grip" problems witnessed on the Apple iPhone 4.
